pageFactoryReset.description: These functions do not perform a secure delete of any sensitive data.

form.resetBiosOptionHelperText: Resets firmware settings including: Platform keystore, partition NVRAM, and partition configurations.
form.resetToDefaultsOptionHelperText: In addition to server settings, this option resets BMC settings, including: all BMC account data, all changed passwords, all policies, LDAP configurations, network addresses, and time of day.

modal.resetBiosHeader: Do you want to reset the server settings?

resetBiosSettingsList.item1: All manual settings will be deleted.
resetBiosSettingsList.item2: Partition configurations and the platform keystore may be recovered if backups exist.

modal.resetToDefaultsHeader: Do you want to reset both the BMC and server settings?

resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item1: All manual settings will be deleted.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item2: Partition configurations and the platform keystore may be recovered if backups exist.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item3: All BMC logs will be removed.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item4: Currently active sessions on all network interfaces will be disconnected.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item5: The BMC default account and password settings will be restored.

modal.resetWarningMessage: Resetting without shutting down the system might cause an unrecoverable error.

toast.successPasswordChanged: Password has been changed successfully.Please relogin with the new password

passwordForHigh.rule1: It should contain printable characters only.
passwordForHigh.rule2: Password length should not be shorter than 8 characters.
passwordForHigh.rule3: Must contain at least 5 unique characters (abcabcabc not allowed)
passwordForHigh.rule8: Contains at least a space or symbols (e.g. $, &).
passwordForHigh.rule9: Could not contains username or the username in reverse order (case insensitive).
passwordForHigh.rule10: Could not contains continuous digits longer than or equal to 3 characters (e.g. BMC(123)ste, BMC(654)sfc are not allowed).
passwordForHigh.rule11: Could not contains continuous case sensitive alphabets longer than or equal to 3 characters (e.g. (AbC)3478!,57$(DeF)68k are not allowed).
passwordForHigh.rule12: Symbols could contain no longer than 3 characters (e.g. 34Mgs57(?!$#)68k are not allowed))
passwordForHigh.rule13: Digits could no longer than 3 characters (e.g. Fgke(1245)#@, (4390)FGL$ are not allowed)
passwordForHigh.rule14: Alphabet could contain no longer than 3 characters (case sensitive) (e.g. Fg1s3as(FDGB), GleOp34!(asbd) are not allowed)

passwordFormedium.rule1: It should contain printable characters only.
passwordFormedium.rule2: Password length should not be shorter than 8 characters.
passwordFormedium.rule3: Must contain at least 5 unique characters (abcabcabc not allowed)
passwordFormedium.rule4: Cannot be the same as the username or the username in reverse order.
passwordFormedium.rule9: Contains at least a space or symbols (e.g. $, &).
passwordFormedium.rule10: Could not contains username or the username in reverse order (case insensitive) (eg,username=Hello, Password=th12(oLleH)_78 is not allowed).

passwordForLow.rule1: It should contain printable characters only.
passwordForLow.rule2: Password length should not be shorter than 6 characters.
passwordForLow.rule3: Must contain at least 5 unique characters (abcabcabc not allowed)
passwordForLow.rule8: Contains at least a space or symbols (e.g. $, &).
passwordForLow.rule9: Could not contains username or the username in reverse order (pam_cracklib will check both) (case insensitive) (eg, username=Hello, both Password=th12(heLLo)_78 and Password=th12(oLleH)_78 is not allowed).

passwordForDisabled.rule1: It should contain printable characters only.
passwordForDisabled.rule2: Password length should not be shorter than 6 characters.
passwordForDisabled.rule3: Cannot be the same as the username or the username in reverse order.
passwordForDisabled.rule4: Must contain at least 5 unique characters (abcabcabc not allowed)

pagePowerRestorePolicy.description: Configure power policy to determine how the system starts after a power disturbance.

policiesDesc.AlwaysOn: Always on - The system always powers on when power is applied.
policiesDesc.AlwaysOff: Always off - The system always remains powered off when power is applied.
policiesDesc.LastState: Last state - The system returns to its last on or off power state when power is applied.
